item.title: Asian stocks rise after Wall Street advance on aid hopes
item.description: BEIJING (AP) — Asian stock markets rose Friday after Wall Street gained on hopes government and central bank action can shield the world economy from a looming recession caused by the coronavirus.

item.title: Stocks, oil prices plunge as virus closes sites around world
item.description: BANGKOK (AP) — The world’s largest economies delivered more worrisome cues Monday as anxiety over the virus outbreak sent stock and oil prices plunging and closed sites from the Sistine Chapel to Saudi Arabian schools.

item.title: Stocks sink, bond yields take another breathtaking drop
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Stocks kept falling Friday, and bond yields took more breathtaking drops as a brutal, dizzying couple weeks of trading showed no sign of letting up.

item.title: Global stocks fall again on fear of virus impact on economy
item.description: Global stock markets plunged extra Friday on spreading fears over the influence of the present coronavirus, with some indexes location to shut out their worst week for the reason that depths of the monetary disaster in 2008.

item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The stock market’s fresh creep hit a tall milestone Thursday after indexes bought pounded for a sixth straight day. The S&P 500 has dropped bigger than 10% from its file excessive, space honest over a week ago, as worries luxuriate in increased that a hasty-spreading new virus will slam economies and company earnings around the sector.

item.title: Stocks go on a wild ride as virus threatens economic damage
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Shares went on a wild trip Thursday as traders battle to gauge the aptitude affect of the coronavirus outbreak on the arena economy.
